translation.text: ME The 51st/53rd Street/Hyde Park East elevator is out of service.
The 51st/53rd Street/Hyde Park East elevator is out of service. Customers can use McCormick Place or 55th/56th/57th Street as alternate boarding stations.
Train #806, scheduled to arrive Chicago 8:12 a.m., is expressing from Chicago Ridge to Chicago due to accommodating passengers off of delayed inbound train #804.
The 95th St/Chicago State University station will close March 3, 2025 - Station Rehab and Expansion Project

On Monday, March 3, the 95th st/Chicago State University station will close for approximately 2 years to undergo a rehabilitation and expansion project. During this time passengers should use 91st street and 103rd st/Rosemoor stations as alternates. Updates will be provided.
Beginning May 9, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station Reconstruction

Beginning May 9, 2025, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station reconstruction. Full site construction is expected to continue through Spring 2026. An accessible alternative is the 111th Street Morgan Park Station. Metra will provide updates once accessibility is restored.

Outbound train #603, scheduled to arrive Blue Island/Vermont Street at 8:16 AM, is stopped near 119th Street due to  police activity. The duration of this delay is unknown. Metra will provide updates as information becomes available.
Monday through Friday, from 9AM to 4PM, the 79th St., 87th St., and 103rd St. stations may not be fully ADA accessible due to nearby station construction.

MDW train #2203 scheduled to arrive Big Timber Road/Elgin at 7:48 AM, may be operating 40 to 50 minutes behind schedule, due to earlier freight train interference and signal problems. Visit metratracker.com for the location of your train.
RI-The Joliet East End Elevator is Out of Service
The Rock Island Eastern Avenue elevator will be out of service for several days. Customers can use the Station elevator to access the boarding platform.
NCS - Inbound Train Movement Has Been Restored - Trains May Be Delayed Up to 45 minutes
Inbound train movement has been restored at Washington St./ Grayslake due to emergency track repairs.  We anticipate trains may be operating up to 45 minutes behind schedule.  Updated at 7:33 a.m.
SWS #804 Scheduled to arrive in Chicago at 7:42 am is on the move and may be operating 40 to 45 minutes behind schedule due positive mechanical issue. UPDATED 7:43AM
MDW train #2212 scheduled to arrive Chicago Union Station at 7:57 AM, may be operating 15 to 25 minutes behind schedule, due to signal problems. Visit metratracker.com for the location of your train.
